body:
Comment 5 by **kaushansky**: 
To be consistent, you need to remove function Count() with sep="" from this package,
too, because it counts ALL 
Runes. Proposed function would count n runes. Why ALL is good, but n is bad? I don't
quite understand what 
kind of bad behaviour it would encourage, nor I understand where N^2 comes from. but if
it's true, same can be 
said about Index. 
For every example where N^2 materializes, similar example can be built based on Index,
it's 1-to-1.
